column4: next question:  i was under the impression i need a separate root login from my normal user login, but Ubuntu install just gave me the one login.  Do I need to seperate them and how do I do it?
You don't.  The root account is locked, you don't use it in Ubuntu.  (sudo is used instead, like the factoid says)
you can check for a particular program wit which.  "which [program]"
